You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
The historical archives floor of the old Senate building is better guarded than you expected. You use air vents to sneak into the building and get as far as the security station outside of Lorn’s office before hitting a dead end. To get inside the office itself, you will have to use the
door. The level of security leads you to believe you are onto something valuable.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} The Empire cannot resolve optional deployments.
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal ({J}) to try and unlock the door to the Foyer.
{-} The mission will progress when a door to the Foyer opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when the round counter increases to 7 or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
The files save to the datacard, which you tuck away. “You got what you wanted, now let me go!” Lorn cries loudly to be heard over the din of combat. He mouths the words “hit me,” so you reluctantly slug him in the chin and he collapses in a heap.

You safely return to your hideout and begin studying the historical records Lorn provided you, but you find it difficult to put the pieces together. You consider asking Lorn for his help again, but you would risk blowing his cover.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive the “Lessons of History” Reward card.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Heroes must choose to continue to ask Lorn for help or pursue other leads. If the heroes continue to ask Lorn for help, place Story Mission card “Double Agent” into play. If they pursue other leads, place Story Mission card “Into a Corner” into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
With alarms blaring and security guards swarming, you are forced to flee the building before you are able to access the historical records. As you withdraw, you hear Lorn thanking the security forces for saving him from those “terrorists.”

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} If a hero claimed Lorn, heroes receive 25 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Alarm triggered
globalEvents.eventText: The noise you make attracts more and more attention. If you don't stay quiet, you won't have much time before you are overwhelmed.

globalEvents.name: End of Round Alerts
globalEvents.eventText:
As quiet as you try to be, the sensors pick up any suspicious activity.

{-} Alerts are increased by 3.

eventActions.theText:
You start working on the terminal.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

globalEvents.name: Unlock Success
globalEvents.eventText: The heavy lock on the Foyer door slides to the side.

entityProperties.name: Foyer Door
entityProperties.theText:
This door leads to the Foyer of Lorn's office.

{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal ({J}) to try and unlock the door to the Foyer.

entityProperties.name: Terminal
entityProperties.theText: A wall-mounted terminal controls the building's systems.

globalEvents.name: High Alert
globalEvents.eventText:
You get through the team at the security station without too much difficulty and release the lock on the door. Inside you find a droid squad and its human commander patrolling a luxurious foyer.

{-} The side door to Lorn's office is locked.
{-} The mission will progress when a door to the Office opens.

entityProperties.name: Foyer Door
entityProperties.theText:
This door leads to the Foyer of Lorn's office.

{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can interact with the terminal ({J}) to try and unlock the door to the Foyer.

eventActions.theText: The room is packed with surveillance equipment controlled from the central security office. You decide to try to keep things nice and quiet to avoid bringing the whole building’s security forces down on your heads.

entityProperties.name: Surveillance System
entityProperties.theText:
The surveillance sensors monitors all suspicious activity.

{-} Each time a Rebel performs an attack, click the surveillance sensors and select "Trigger Alert".

eventActions.theText:
{-} The blue Imperial mission token represents the surveillance sensors.
{-} When 12 alerts have been triggered, the round counter increases by 1.
{-} At the end of each round, 3 alerts are added to the count.
{-} Each time a Rebel performs an attack, click the surveillance sensors and select "Trigger Alert".
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with an Imperial figure ({K}) for that Imperial figure to suffer {H} equal to the number of successes. If that Imperial figure is a DROID, that Rebel figure can test {I} instead. Before performing the test, that figure may suffer 1 {C} to apply +1 to the test results.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Office opens.

{-} The Empire cannot resolve optional deployments.
{-} The side door to Lorn's office is locked.
{-} When 12 alerts have been triggered, the round counter increases by 1.
{-} At the end of each round, 3 alerts are added to the count.
{-} Each time a Rebel performs an attack, click the surveillance sensors and select "Trigger Alert".
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with an Imperial figure ({K}) for that Imperial figure to suffer {H} equal to the number of successes. If that Imperial figure is a DROID, that Rebel figure can test {I} instead. Before performing the test, that figure may suffer 1 {C} to apply +1 to the test results.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Office opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when the round counter increases to 7 or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Historical Records
globalEvents.eventText:
Lorn’ office again subverted your expectations. Its size and grandeur imply that Lorn’s work with the Empire is more important than you first thought.

When you open the door to the office, Lorn looks up from his work at his desk.

“Who are you?” he demands. “What is the meaning of this?”

{-} The neutral mission token represents Lorn. A hero can interact with Lorn to talk to him.
{-} The mission will progress when a hero talks to Lorn.

entityProperties.name: Office Main Door
entityProperties.theText: This is the main door to Lorn's office.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The Empire cannot resolve optional deployments.
{-} The side door to Lorn's office is locked.
{-} When 12 alerts have been triggered, the round counter increases by 1.
{-} At the end of each round, 3 alerts are added to the count.
{-} Each time a Rebel performs an attack, click the surveillance sensors and select "Trigger Alert".
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with an Imperial figure ({K}) for that Imperial figure to suffer {H} equal to the number of successes. If that Imperial figure is a DROID, that Rebel figure can test {I} instead. Before performing the test, that figure may suffer 1 {C} to apply +1 to the test results.
{-} The neutral mission token represents Lorn. A hero can interact with Lorn to talk to him.
{-} The mission will progress when a hero talks to Lorn.
{-} The Rebels lose when the round counter increases to 7 or when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Ambush
globalEvents.eventText:
You quickly explain to Lorn who you are. 

“I'll give you what you want, just don't hurt me,” Lorn says with his hands raised. You are confused for a moment until Lorn gives you a wink. “You can only access what you are looking for from the security station.”

You grab Lorn by the collar and shove him in the direction of the terminal, doing your best to try to keep his cover intact.

{-} The hero that interacted with Lorn claims Lorn.
{-} The Empire can now resolve optional deployments.
{-} Alerts are no longer triggered.
{-} The hero that has claimed Lorn can interact with the terminal to download the historical records.
{-} If the hero who claimed Lorn withdraws, place Lorn in the space that hero occupied.
{-} The Rebels win when they download the historical records.

entityProperties.name: Office Side Door
entityProperties.theText:
The side door to Lorn's office is locked tight.

{-} This door is locked.

entityProperties.name: Lorn
entityProperties.theText: This is Lorn.

entityProperties.name: Surveillance System
entityProperties.theText: The surveillance sensors have triggered the building's alarm. It cannot be turned off.

entityProperties.name: Terminal
entityProperties.theText:
A wall-mounted terminal controls the building's systems.

{-} The hero that has claimed Lorn can interact with the terminal to download the historical records.

eventActions.theText:
{-} The hero that has claimed Lorn can interact with the terminal to download the historical records.
{-} If the hero who claimed Lorn withdraws, place Lorn in the space that hero occupied.
{-} The Rebels win when they download the historical records.

globalEvents.name: Story 1
globalEvents.eventText:
Despite his performance, the Empire has suspicions about Lorn and decides to surveil him.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Double Agent” into play.

globalEvents.name: Story 2
globalEvents.eventText:
Even though the Rebels did not succeed, the Empire sees them as a threat and decides to track them.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Into a Corner” into play.
